text: Hey guys, just a quick question. Have you guys implemented the hubpost site search? If so, does it search within the blog posts as well? It doesn't seem to be doing so for me :confused:

it’s configurable you can make it search blog posts or just pages or both.

You’ll need to edit the default site search module to see - there’s a comment in there explaining that if I remember correct

question - anyone know what part of HubSpot uses these URLs?
<http://hs-sites.origin.HubSpot.net/_hcms/preview/template?portalId=[numbers]&path=generated_layouts/[numbers].html>

I installed rollbar onto a client’s site and it threw a bunch of errors with URLs like that.
I’m thinking that it’s a problem with a template preview or page editor preview but I don’t recall seeing the URL’s looking quite like that. I thought they were different. I don’t recognize hs-sites.ORIGIN
starting to think it might be an internal HS tool being run - the IPs that are triggering this are using chrome on linux. and there was a spike of activity at 10pm cst then nothing.
Hi Job, thanks for replying. That was my thought, I took a look at both search input and search result components and they don't have any configurations available. :confused:

Hoping someone can put my mind at ease here.  I was doing some work for a potential (now real) client in a free portal with a Marketing Professional trial.  Trial period has now ended.

If they upgrade, will all the work I did in Design Manager still be there?
Pretty sure that is the case but I will let someone more confident answer. 80% confident you are good.
It should as long as it is the same portal
Is there a timeline on when these items would be removed? I'm thinking 6 months if it happens
I cant remember that.
I know you can call in and get an extension if you are actively working in it.
That is on a per case basis
may be worth a call to support <@U54TVT3C1>
yeah.  Unfortunately I let this sub expire.  I'll see what I can do
Call the rep.
RIGHT like support handles that
I have lost info in the past, but I'm pretty sure it was more related to domain settings and things like that. I'm pretty sure design manager assets stayed, but YMMV
Not support. Their CAM or The clients rep.
Yeah, your milage could be on a bicycle in the snow
my favourite kind
I like having conversations with you in two different windows lol
I can email you too if you'd like
I wouldn't see it for an hour or three
Skipped support and went straight to Channel Account Manager.  Fingers crossed
I've skipped support to go to the CAM many of times when its something dire. Actually just did it last week lol

Yeah, I'd call your Channel Account Manager and chat. There should be a way to get it.

Also, I know you were in Marketing Pro trial, but for the new Stand-alone CMS ... that is free forever until you launch. So you can spin up a stand-alone cms portal, build the site, and there's no time limit (as long as you're actively working in it) and you don't pay until you launch the website.
> This way you can always start with CMS stand-alone, build/design, then upgrade to Marketing Pro when you're ready to launch... and finish up building out any marketing related items (workflows, social, etc) just before launching. This will avoid any trial time limits.
That is great info thanks <@U22PKFRU5>
Worth reposting in general: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CCQ7H31D5/p1544036935007400>
^^Means you can build epic HubDB driven pages :100:% locally, like this awesome one :cat:
haha, lol'ing hard at the cat selfie. ... looks like me when I join a Zoom and video is automatically on.
why is this page no on the web?  why so selfish?
conversely, i like the idea of <@U6W3H6YN8> getting to the office, sipping his coffee and spinning up his local dev server and being greeted with this page and knowing that he alone has access to it
evil grin on his face
humming “I’ve got the world on a string”
and in his head, thinking “pun intended.  pun definitely intended”
ok. done
_Mew_ bring up a good point here, <@UD53A9UUR>. Just gotta make sure my content is _purr-fect_ before going live, don't want to _fur-get_ any kittens - that would be a _cat-astrophe_
that would _litter_ ally be the worst
doh
litterally laughed out loud and my co-workers looked at me and my screen and gave me a goofy look
Just make sure it goes through proper QA, each cat needs to be properly _vetted_
#dadjokesfordevs
need a t-shirt that some how combines the best of both the dev world and dad jokes
done
lol
